Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a fish in its natural habitat, like a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can include and label the components within the habitat, such as water, plants, and rocks.
The student can show and label what the fish needs to survive, like water and the food it eats.
The student can illustrate and label other living things in the habitat, if any, such as plants or other animals.
The student can demonstrate how the habitat and its features work together to meet the needs of the fish, showing the water for swimming and food sources available.
